Quotes: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Both oligarch and tyrant mistrust the people, and therefore deprive them of their arms.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Who had deceived thee so often as thyself?
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Trouble springs from idleness, and grievous toil from needless ease.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Regrets are the natural property of grey hairs.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: It opens the lungs, washes the countenance, exercises the eyes, and softens down the temper;so cry away.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Despair is a narcotic. It lulls the mind into indifference.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: Hatred is inveterate anger.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Great is the power of habit. It teaches us to bear fatigue and to despise wounds and pain.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The enemy is within the gates;it is with our own luxury, our own folly, our own criminality that we have to contend.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Everything is pathology, except for indifference.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Once we have a war there is only one thing to do. It must be won. For defeat brings worse things than any that can ever happen in war.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: What is called generosity is usually only the vanity of giving;we enjoy the vanity more than the thing given.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: One advantage in keeping a diary is that you become aware with reassuring clarity of the changes which you constantly suffer.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: Evil is whatever distracts.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: My reputation grows with every failure.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Lack of money is the root of all evil.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: There is nothing more dangerous than the conscience of a bigot.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: There are many victories worse than a defeat.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Cruelty, like every other vice, requires no motive outside of itself;it only requires opportunity.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The first step towards vice is to shroud innocent actions in mystery, and whoever likes to conceal something sooner or later has reason to conceal it.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quotes: A thousand years may scare form a state. An hour may lay it in ruins.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow;there is no humor in Heaven.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Hate traps us by binding us too tightly to our adversary.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Ambition is the last refuge of the failure.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Pain is as diverse as man. One suffers as one can.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Civil war? What does that mean? Is there any foreign war? Isn't every war fought between men, between brothers?
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out;and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: The older one grows, the more one likes indecency.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Farewell, fair cruelty.
Author: William Shakespeare
